event.title: <show-title>Twin Peaks</show-title> <event-type-title>Episodes 14-17</event-type-title>
event.description:
Episode 14: "Demons" | 47 mins.
Donna tries to convince Truman that Harold Smith has Laura's secret diary.

Episode 15: "Lonely Souls" | 47 mins.
Cooper and the One-Armed Man inspect guests at the Great Northern.

Episode 16: "Drive with a Dead Girl" | 47 mins.
The One-Armed Man escapes custody.

Episode 17: "Arbitrary Law" | 47 mins.
Cooper tricks the killer into revealing himself.

show.title: Josie and the Pussycats
show.headline: Conform! Free will is overrated! Jump on the bandwagon!

event.title: <show-title>Josie and the Pussycats</show-title>
event.headline: Programmed by Charli xcx, ahead of her film THE MOMENT
event.description:
JOSIE AND THE PUSSYCATS is presented as part of our Charli xcx Guest Selects for her new film, THE MOMENT.

Art + capitalism = product placement, I guess? In a time where it’s encouraged to unashamedly go and get the bag, this film is reminiscent of purer days when selling out was deemed lame and dishonest! I’ve always loved it, but I’ve also always loved a brand deal, so I probably would have been down for all the brainwashing. (Charli xcx)

show.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2
show.headline: The epic finale that will live forever

landscapeHeroImage.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 2

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 2

posterImages.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 2

event.title: <show-title>The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: We've seen your future – it involves you having a blast at this epic movie party
event.description:
After all this time, we finally understand why we’ve been so obsessed with TWILIGHT SAGA Movie Parties. It was this one, BREAKING DAWN PART 2…we imprinted on it and want you to too! It’s a wolf thing, we have no control over it, but that doesn’t mean we can’t still have fun.

The epic conclusion to TWILIGHT sees newly vamped Bella the proud mom of a creepy, rapidly growing, werewolf-imprinted, half-vampire/half-human baby with a totally normal name. The Volturi aren’t too happy about that so the Cullens and their allies will have to prepare for an all-out decapitation fest. Prepare for the final battle with some magnifico-themed props, including some tiny hands that can feel into your mind and a pen and notebook so you can take notes on how to act human.

No one has loved a Movie Party series as much as we love this one (with one exception). We thought it would last forever but forever isn’t as long as we’d hoped, so be sure to book your seats while they last.

show.title: Tales From The Crypt: Demon Knight
show.headline: Neon, slime, and hordes of hell-demons

landscapeHeroImage.altText: TALES FROM THE CRYPT: DEMON KNIGHT

portraitHeroImage.altText: TALES FROM THE CRYPT: DEMON KNIGHT

event.title: <show-title>Tales From The Crypt: Demon Knight</show-title>
event.headline: Ernest Dickerson’s neon-slimer
event.description:
Welcome to the most joyful, outrageous, and gloopiest terror blast of the 1990s. A full-length version of the iconic Tales From the Crypt television show on steroids, DEMON KNIGHT follows mysterious drifter Brayker (William Sadler) and spitfire Jeryline (Jada Pinkett-Smith) as they hold off an army of beasties under the command of The Collector (Billy Zane). Directed by the mighty Ernest Dickerson (cinematographer on Spike Lee’s DO THE RIGHT THING) and overflowing with phenomenal creature effects, this is a living comic book that demands to be experienced on the big screen.

Screening an archival 35mm print in select locations

show.title: The Phantom of the Opera (2004)
show.headline: The classic musical comes to life on the big screen

event.title: <event-type-title>Alamo Crafthouse:</event-type-title> <show-title>The Phantom of the Opera (2004)</show-title>
event.headline: Craft in the shadows of a classic romance
event.description: How’s this for a strange duet? Joel Schumacher’s 2004 gothic romance paired with hands-on crafting designed just for the movie. Each guest receives two craft sets to work on from their seat, including Phantom-inspired calligraphy with guided activity sheets and a card to fill in, sign, and seal. You’ll also create an iconic red paper rose with step-by-step instructions, all while enjoying food and drinks delivered right to your seat.

You’ll also create an iconic red paper rose with step-by-step instructions, all while enjoying food and drinks delivered right to your seat.

show.title: Wuthering Heights (2026)
show.headline: Emerald Fennell's sensual and sensuous reimagining of Emily Brontë's love story

event.title: <show-title>Wuthering Heights (2026)</show-title> <event-type-title>Book Club Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Go the full Brontë at our Book Club Screening
event.description:
Will you be watching WUTHERING HEIGHTS while quietly noting what they did and did not include from the book? You’re among friends. Our first-ever Book Club Screening invites readers, rereaders, and mild obsessives to settle in for some big-screen brooding, complete with a live host and a post-film sense of scholarly vindication. Your ticket also includes an exclusive sticker and access to our WUTHERING HEIGHTS cocktail menu inspired by the film.

The following Book Club screenings will also include a Drafthouse Book Fair with local bookstores and libraries in the bar after the movie:

  • Littleton
  • Lamar
  • Lower Manhattan
  • DTLA
  • Raleigh
  • Cedars

imageAsset.title: Wuthering Heights Cathy Doll Tee Web Assets Deluxe Showpage 1920x1080

image.altText: Wuthering Heights Cathy Doll Tee Web Assets Deluxe Showpage 1920x1080

contentBlocks.paragraphs: Upgrade your ticket with our limited-edition WUTHERING HEIGHTS Long-Sleeve T-Shirt, available as an exclusive add-on while supplies last. Featuring the Cathy doll from the film on the front and the reverse view with film logo on the back, this robin’s egg blue, screen-printed shirt is designed by our own Grace Svoboda. It’s perfect for wearing to your book club, around the house, or while brooding on a moor somewhere in England. Consider it essential outerwear for romantic despair.

eventType.title: Book Club Screening
eventType.headline: Collect custom stickers as you enjoy your favorite movie adaptations
eventType.description: Celebrate your favorite book-turned-movie with the Alamo Drafthouse Movie Book Club. Get your passport at the show, then fill it with custom-themed stickers at each Book Club screening. Join us in the bar after the film to connect with local bookstores, libraries, and other book lovers. Keep reading and keep watching!

event.title: <show-title>Wuthering Heights (2026)</show-title> <event-type-title>Costume Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Party like it's 1779 at our costume screening
event.description: Dress for doomed romance at our costume screenings of WUTHERING HEIGHTS with a live host, prizes, and a themed cocktail menu. Guests are encouraged to arrive in their finest late 18th-century attire, whether that means Heathcliff’s dark, weather-beaten coats, Catherine Earnshaw’s flowing gowns and windswept curls, or Edgar Linton’s polished waistcoats and cravats. Bust out lace, linen, velvet, boots, shawls, and anything that looks suitable for brooding on a moor. Period-inspired outfits are strongly encouraged, but true emotional commitment is required.

Bust out lace, linen, velvet, boots, shawls, and anything that looks suitable for brooding on a moor. Period-inspired outfits are strongly encouraged, but true emotional commitment is required.

show.title: Longlegs
show.headline: A disturbing case hits a little close to home for a rookie FBI agent

event.title: <show-title>Longlegs</show-title> <event-type-title>Free Victory Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Nicolas Cage at his weirdest
event.description:
From horror maestro Osgood Perkins (THE MONKEY) comes a case of creeping terror with a sinister performance from the one, the only, Nicolas Cage. After being assigned an unresolved serial killer case, rookie FBI agent Lee Harker (Maika Monroe, IT FOLLOWS) must follow cryptic, occult clues to bring an end to the infamous killer’s spree. The deeper she goes, though, the more personal the case becomes.

LONGLEGS is a bit like an ominous riddle that you can't help but puzzle over, even as you realize the answer will only scare the pants off you. It’s a deliciously creepy thriller with an unhinged villain performance from Nicolas Cage (as if he gives any other kind). Reserve your spot now by purchasing a fully refundable food and beverage voucher redeemable for snacks and non-alcoholic drinks at the show.

imageAsset.title: Raccoon City Cinema Menu Web Deluxe Showpage 1920x1080

image.altText: Raccoon City Cinema Menu Web Deluxe Showpage 1920x1080

contentBlocks.paragraphs: Before CAPCOM’s Resident Evil Requiem hits PlayStation® 5, catch four unsettling horror classics on the big screen: THE THING (1982), THE RING, THE CABIN IN THE WOODS, and LONGLEGS. Together, these films capture what Resident Evil has always done best: making you feel like the worst decisions were made long before you arrived, and now all that’s left is survival. These screenings will also feature an exclusive menu inspired by the Resident Evil series, including the “Bingo!” Fried Chicken Plate and the T-Virus Cocktail. Reserve your spot now by purchasing a fully refundable food and beverage voucher redeemable for snacks and non-alcoholic drinks at the show.

eventType.description: Calling all Victory Members! We’re saying thanks with a free screening. Just buy a food & beverage voucher to reserve your seat, and then use it toward food and drink at the show.

show.title: The Cabin in the Woods
show.headline: You think you know the story

event.title: <show-title>The Cabin in the Woods</show-title> <event-type-title>Free Victory Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: You think you know the story
event.description: This modern meta-horror classic by Drew Goddard (THE MARTIAN) starts as a standard “cabin in the woods” movie starring Chris Hemsworth, but subverts all expectations by its final act. It’s got the DNA of Goddard’s best Buffy the Vampire Slayer episodes, but even more genre-bending fun in a feature-length package. THE CABIN IN THE WOODS rewards repeat viewings – go see it on the big screen. Reserve your spot now by purchasing a fully refundable food and beverage voucher redeemable for snacks and non-alcoholic drinks at the show.

show.title: The Ring (2002)
show.headline: Before you die, you see...the ring

event.title: <show-title>The Ring (2002)</show-title> <event-type-title>Free Victory Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Before you die, you see...the ring
event.description: It sounds like just another urban legend – a videotape filled with nightmarish images leads to a phone call foretelling the viewer's death in exactly seven days. Newspaper reporter Rachel Keller (Naomi Watts) is skeptical of the story until four teenagers all die mysteriously exactly one week after watching just such a tape. Allowing her investigative curiosity to get the better of her, Rachel tracks down the video and watches it. Now she has just seven days to unravel the mystery. Reserve your spot now by purchasing a fully refundable food and beverage voucher redeemable for snacks and non-alcoholic drinks at the show.

show.title: The Thing (1982)
show.headline: Paranoid terror deep in the heart of the arctic, John Carpenter-style

event.title: <show-title>The Thing (1982)</show-title> <event-type-title>Free Victory Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: John Carpenter’s body horror triumph on the big screen
event.description: Once called a "great barf-bag movie" by film critic Roger Ebert, THE THING is that and much, much more. Kurt Russell leads a group of scientists – including Keith David (THEY LIVE) – who are stranded at a deserted base in Antarctica. But as it turns out, they’re not so alone after all. Featuring dreamy photography from Dean Cundey (HALLOWEEN), an extraordinary synth score from genre legend Ennio Morricone, and unstoppable ‘80s creature effects by Rob Bottin, THE THING is a body horror triumph and one of John Carpenter’s most artful terrifiers. You’ll never look at blizzards the same way again. Reserve your spot now by purchasing a fully refundable food and beverage voucher redeemable for snacks and non-alcoholic drinks at the show.

Reserve your spot now by purchasing a fully refundable food and beverage voucher redeemable for snacks and non-alcoholic drinks at the show.

eventType.title: Free Victory Screening
eventType.headline: Our way of saying thank you to our Victory Members
eventType.description: Calling all Victory Members! We’re saying thanks with a free screening. Just buy a food & beverage voucher to reserve your seat, and then use it toward food and drink at the show.

titleCardImage.altText: Free Victory Screening Art Card

show.title: By Design
show.headline: A woman envies the life of a perfect chair so much that she swaps bodies with it

event.title: <show-title>By Design</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Director     Amanda Kramer Live in Person
event.description:
In-person Q&A with filmmaker Amanda Kramer following the screening

Upon seeing a gorgeous chair in a showroom, Camille (Juliette Lewis) realizes that she truly envies the life of this perfect piece of furniture. If only she could be someone’s favorite thing. When she and the chair swap forms, Camille learns that she is better liked as an inanimate object than she was as a person: her mother (Betty Buckley) finds her to be a better listener, and her best friends (Samantha Mathis and Robin Tunney) enjoy a newfound, friction-free rapport. As the chair, Camille is unable to speak or move, and winds up in the hands of Olivier (Mamoudou Athie), a minimalist bachelor who gradually becomes romantically fixated on his elegant new possession. Narrated by Melanie Griffith, this modern fable celebrates the messiness of female interiority with deadpan humor, surrealist flourishes, and interpretative dance numbers. An absurdist spin on the body-swap comedy, BY DESIGN is a bold new work from singular filmmaker Amanda Kramer.

eventType.title: Live Q&A

eventType.description: Got a question for the director? Wanna meet the cast? At our special Live Q&A events, we follow the screening with an in-person discussion.

event.title: <show-title>Send Help</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline:
Screenwriter     Mark Swift, 
      Screenwriter     Damian Shannon Live in Person
event.description:
In-person Q&A with screenwriters Mark Swift and Damian Shannon following the screening

Two colleagues become stranded on a deserted island, the only survivors of a plane crash. On the island, they must overcome past grievances and work together to survive, but ultimately, it's an unsettling, darkly humorous battle of wills and wits to make it out alive.

event.title: <show-title>Nirvanna The Band The Show The Movie</show-title> <event-type-title>w/Livestream Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Catch it early with a livestream Q&A with Matt & Jay
event.description: You will have questions after seeing NIRVANNA THE BAND THE SHOW THE MOVIE. Questions like “How much is real and how much is fake?”, “Is the Rivoli a real venue in Toronto?”, and “Is Orbitz the key ingredient in time travel?”. Hopefully, the stars and creators, Jay McCarrol and Matt Johnson, will have answers, but they probably won’t. One thing is certain: they’ll go on very funny tangents in a livestream Q&A following the movie. Your ticket to this special screening also gives you access to our themed menu that includes the Rivoli Spicy Chicken Sandwich and Time Travel Mash cocktail.

show.title: 13 Going on 30
show.headline: For some, 13 feels like it was just yesterday. For Jenna, it was.

event.title: <show-title>13 Going on 30</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Celebrate being 30, flirty & thriving at our interactive movie party
event.description:
When 13 GOING ON 30 was released over 20 years ago(!), I was overjoyed at the fact that Hollywood had finally decided to make BIG for girls. Don't get me wrong, it was awesome to watch Tom Hanks spend his paycheck on video games and a penthouse with a trampoline, but now it was a gal's turn to live the dream, and Jennifer Garner did not disappoint. This film features the greatest fantasies of a 13-year-old girl*: a makeover montage in a gigantic closet, a high-power job working at a fashion magazine, a massive slumber party, and, of course, a totally cute guy.

But 13 GOING ON 30 isn't just a fun premise, it's a heartfelt and hilarious coming-of-age story. The cast is top-notch, with Garner perfectly embodying her inner teen, Judy Greer serving up some major sass (like she does), and Mark Ruffalo being as foxy and charming as he's ever been. This delightful cinematic concoction is better than a pack of Razzles, so join us and experience the thrill of being 30, flirty, and thriving.

*Or any girl, regardless of her age. Because that shoe collection! WANT. (Sarah Pitre)

Your ticket includes the following props:

  • Butterfly tattoo – Just like Jenna's favorite accessory.
  • Tissues – No need to look like a model. You're beautiful just as you are.
  • Mantra sleepmask – The best years of your life.
  • Wishing dust - What do you wish for in your heart of hearts?

show.title: My Best Friend's Wedding
show.headline: Julia Roberts realizes she's in love with her best friend after he gets engaged

event.title: <show-title>My Best Friend's Wedding</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Julia Roberts realizes she's in love with her best friend after he gets engaged
event.description:
The romcom that really isn’t a romcom (but it really is), MY BEST FRIEND’S WEDDING stars Julia Roberts as a “two-faced, big-haired food critic” who schemes to break up the upcoming nuptials of her long-time friend days before his wedding. Spinning the genre in ways not seen often (or for that matter, since), this is the type of film you turn to when watching "Happily Ever After..." gives you too many cavities.

Cameron Diaz, handpicked by Roberts herself, goes toe-to-toe with America's sweetheart and holds her own against one of cinema's most charming leads. And Diaz, in the process, becomes one herself.

Your ticket includes the following props:

  • Microphone – No one cares how bad you sing. It's karaoke!
  • Wedding veil – Just keep on wishin' and hopin'.
  • Lobster claw mitts – When the table breaks out in song, that's your sign to put your claws in the air.

show.title: The Substance
show.headline: A gorgeously gross beauty regimen that will change your life

event.title: <show-title>The Substance</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: A gorgeously gross beauty regimen that will change your life
event.description:
Oh, the things we do for beauty. Look, we’re not saying we wouldn’t want to look like Margaret Qualley, but Demi Moore’s over-the-hill aerobic star goes to some pretty extreme measures. Her use of THE SUBSTANCE may transform her into a “younger, more beautiful, more perfect” version of herself (via a gloriously horrific rebirth), but the more she uses it, the worse the side effects become. It becomes increasingly apparent that beauty is only skin deep as both of her lives spiral into a truly ugly mess.

THE SUBSTANCE is a wild, toe-curling ride from writer/director Coralie Fargeat that features some of the most nerve-shredding body horror sequences in recent years. And with it taking home the award for Best Screenplay at the 2024 Cannes Film Festival, there’s plenty of substance behind the camera as well. As fantastical as the beauty solution is, THE SUBSTANCE’s themes of aging, youth, and self-esteem are very much grounded in our obsession with physical beauty.

Your ticket includes the following props:

  • Activator pen – For a younger, more beautiful, more perfect version of yourself.
  • Termination glass – But sometimes perfection is overrated.
  • Body horror toy – There may not be chicken wings in here, but it's still oddly satisfying to play with.
  • "You Are One" sticker – Respect the balance.
  • Walk of Fame keychain – Sometimes your legacy gets so mixed up, they even spell your name wrong.
  • Monstro Elisasue mask – Nothing else matters so long as you are pretty on the outside.

show.title: Primate

show.title: My Own Private Idaho
show.headline: A queer romance on the fringes

posterImages.altText: MY OWN PRIVATE IDAHO sp poster

event.title: <show-title>My Own Private Idaho</show-title>
event.headline: Reeves and Phoenix in Gus Van Sant’s ode to Shakespeare and queer limerence
event.description:
“I love you, and you don’t pay me.”

Queer longing is an expansive, meandering, and maddening thing. It’s often difficult to pinpoint the beginning of a crush or why exactly a desire erupts from a space where nothing existed before. Sometimes it’s as simple as “you make this all feel a little less bad,” and we can call that love or infatuation, but any label doesn’t make the feeling any less real. In Gus Van Sant’s third film, MY OWN PRIVATE IDAHO, the writer/director combines multiple scripts, a short story, and a handful of source materials into a kaleidoscopic exploration of queerness, youth, and loneliness. Narcoleptic sex worker Mike Waters (River Phoenix) spends his days hustling in the Pacific Northwest with his closest friend, Scott Favor (Keanu Reeves). Mike nurses a destabilizing affection for Scott and a difficult relationship with his father (James Russo). At the same time, Scott attempts to reject his privileged background in favor of slumming with street hustlers and their eccentric mentor, Pigeon Bob (William Richert). When an opportunity arises to locate Mike’s estranged mother, he embarks on a journey of self-discovery with Scott across the United States and Europe. Non-linear, variegated, and heartfelt, MY OWN PRIVATE IDAHO is the transitional intersection of Van Sant’s arthouse stylistic roots and his future commercial successes with TO DIE FOR and GOOD WILL HUNTING. Filled to the brim with dreamy queer disillusionment and featuring iconic performances from the late River Phoenix and everyone’s favorite hunk Keanu Reeves, MY OWN PRIVATE IDAHO is the perfect film to launch the 2026 season of Queer Film Theory 101.

DCP courtesy of Warner Bros.

show.title: Nirvanna The Band The Show
show.headline: Matt and Jay try to book a show at The Rivoli

event.title: <show-title>Nirvanna The Band The Show</show-title> <event-type-title>Greatest Hits</event-type-title>
event.headline: Rewatch some of our favorite episodes of the show ahead of Matt & Jay's new film
event.description:
In anticipation of our new Drafthouse Recommends film NIRVANNA THE BAND THE SHOW THE MOVIE, catch some of our favorite episodes of Nirvanna The Band The Show on the big screen.

S1E1: "The Banner"
In an effort to raise awareness about the band, Matt and Jay drop a huge banner across from The Rivoli. It turns out to be more revealing than originally planned.

S1E3: "The Bean"
The guys try to get a float into the annual Santa Claus parade. Challenges abound, leaving them wondering if they will get their Christmas miracle.

S2E1: "The Burger"
Fake fans, real results. Could a bite of a WahlBurger get Matt and Jay closer to their dream of playing The Rivoli?

S2E4: "The Book"
On Halloween night, Jay finds a cursed music book hidden in the house. In this fun but terrifying quest, the guys work together to have order restored. Watch out for Van Pelt!

show.title: Identikit (aka The Driver's Seat)
show.headline: Liz Taylor runs amok through the streets of Rome

event.title: <show-title>Identikit (aka The Driver's Seat)</show-title>
event.headline: Liz Taylor runs amok through the streets of Rome.
event.description: In what remains the most obscure, bizarre, and wildly misunderstood film of her entire career – and perhaps even 1970s Italian cinema – IDENTIKIT (aka THE DRIVER'S SEAT) stars Elizabeth Taylor as a disturbed woman who arrives in Rome to find a fragmented city. From there, Taylor navigates autocratic law, leftist violence, and her own increasingly unhinged mission to find the most dangerous liaison of all. Academy Award® nominee Ian Bannen (THE OFFENCE), Mona Washbourne (THE COLLECTOR), and Andy Warhol co-star in this hallucinatory neo-noir, which was photographed by three-time Oscar® winner Vittorio Storaro (APOCALYPSE NOW, THE LAST EMPEROR). New restored in 4K by Severin Films!

event.description:

I wasn’t sure whether to include this film because it’s an uncomfortable watch, to say the least, but I did in the end because I think it portrays how the safety of artists and their mental health is still consistently exploited within the entertainment industry. (Charli xcx)

event.title: <show-title>Dance Freak</show-title>
event.headline: A dangerous Dance Freak runs wild
event.description:
Including the new short film YUCKY GUY

In a secret government facility, a team of scientists has done impossible, indescribable things. Genetic mutations, inter-dimensional experiments – nasty top-secret stuff. They played GOD. And like GOD, they are all probably dead. The filmmakers only had $45,000 to make this movie, and they ran out of that money almost immediately, so a lot of that stuff is just implied through dialogue. There is dancing, but it isn’t that crazy. Also, the movie gets loud sometimes, but it's not that long.

show.title: Dracula (2026)
show.headline: A prince cursed with eternal life seeks to bring his lover back from death

event.title: <show-title>Dracula (2026)</show-title> <event-type-title>Early Access</event-type-title>
event.headline: A prince cursed with eternal life seeks to bring his lover back from death
event.description: When a 15th-century prince (Caleb Landry Jones) witnesses the brutal murder of his wife (Zoë Bleu), he renounces God and damns heaven itself. Cursed with eternal life, he is reborn as Dracula, an immortal warlord who defies fate in a blood-soaked crusade to wrench his lost love back from death, no matter the cost. On the verge of reuniting, Dracula is hunted by a relentless priest (Christoph Waltz), sworn to end his immortal reign.

show.title: Twin Peaks: The Return
show.headline: Twenty-five years after the murder of Laura Palmer, the story continues

event.title: <show-title>Twin Peaks: The Return</show-title> <event-type-title>Parts 1-3</event-type-title>
event.description:
Part 1 | 61 mins.
Cooper remains trapped in the Black Lodge. Mysterious events occur in South Dakota. A murder investigation begins, and old faces return.

Part 2 | 61 mins.
Cooper tries to escape the Black Lodge. A new murder investigation begins. Doppelgänger Cooper causes chaos.

Part 3 | 60 mins.
Cooper finds himself in a strange place. Dougie Jones' life is disrupted. Janey-E tries to handle Dougie's unusual behavior.

show.title: Twin Peaks: The Return
show.headline: Twenty-five years after the murder of Laura Palmer, the story continues

event.title: <show-title>Twin Peaks: The Return</show-title> <event-type-title>Parts 10-12</event-type-title>
event.description:
Part 10 | 60 mins.
The search for Cooper continues; more pieces of the puzzle come together. Richard Horne's violent behavior escalates, and Dougie's family faces danger.

Part 11 | 60 mins.
Events in Twin Peaks take a dark turn; Dougie's fate hangs in the balance. The FBI moves closer to finding Cooper, and a child is hit by a car.

Part 12 | 60 mins.
The investigation leads to unexpected places; familiar faces return. Audrey Horne makes a troubling appearance, and Sarah Palmer's behavior is erratic.

event.title: <show-title>Twin Peaks: The Return</show-title> <event-type-title>Parts 13-15</event-type-title>
event.description:
Part 13 | 60 mins.
Cooper's return seems imminent; old secrets are unearthed. Dougie wins a jackpot, and the Mitchum brothers' storyline unfolds.

Part 14 | 60 mins.
Cooper's allies make progress; the true nature of the Black Lodge is explored. Gordon Cole has a vision, and Andy visits the White Lodge.

Part 15 | 60 mins.
Cooper's journey reaches a critical point; the past and present collide. Big Ed and Norma's romance blossoms, and Steven and Gersten's story takes a dark turn.

show.title: Twin Peaks: The Return
show.headline: Twenty-five years after the murder of Laura Palmer, the story continues

event.title: <show-title>Twin Peaks: The Return</show-title> <event-type-title>Parts 16-18</event-type-title>
event.description:
Part 16 | 60 mins.
Cooper regains his identity; a showdown looms. Diane's true nature is revealed, and Dougie says goodbye to his family.

Part 17 | 60 mins.
Cooper confronts the ultimate evil; the truth about Laura Palmer is revealed. The final showdown with Mr. C occurs, and Judy's role is hinted at.

Part 18 | 60 mins.
Cooper's journey comes to a surreal and ambiguous conclusion. Cooper and Diane cross into another reality, leaving their fates uncertain.

event.title: <show-title>Twin Peaks: The Return</show-title> <event-type-title>Parts 4-6</event-type-title>
event.description:
Part 4 | 60 mins.
Cooper adjusts to his new life as Dougie; Hawk gets closer to solving the mystery. Gordon Cole and Albert Rosenfield investigate Cooper's disappearance.

Part 5 | 60 mins.
Cooper, still as Dougie, goes to work; mysterious clues emerge. Janey-E deals with Dougie's debt, and Cooper's true identity remains hidden.

Part 6 | 60 mins.
Cooper experiences more strange events; Dougie's world is in danger. A hitman is sent after Dougie, and Hawk makes a discovery.

event.title: <show-title>Twin Peaks: The Return</show-title> <event-type-title>Parts 7-9</event-type-title>
event.description:
Part 7 | 60 mins.
The investigation in Twin Peaks intensifies. Cooper/Dougie's behavior raises suspicion. Major Briggs' body is found, and Diane is brought into the investigation.

Part 8 | 60 mins.
A surreal journey into the origins of evil; the birth of BOB is revealed. The episode explores the atomic bomb test and its supernatural consequences.

Part 9 | 60 mins.
Cooper's friends work to bring him back; the mystery deepens. The search for Dougie's origins continues, and the FBI makes a breakthrough.

event.title: <show-title>Twin Peaks</show-title> <event-type-title>Episodes 10-13</event-type-title>
event.description:
Episode 10: "Coma" | 47 mins.
Donna meets Harold Smith, a friend of Laura's. Cooper receives more cryptic clues, and Maddy has a vision of Bob.

Episode 11: "The Man Behind Glass" | 47 mins.
Albert returns to Twin Peaks with new evidence. Harold shows Donna Laura's secret diary, and Ben and Jerry discuss a new business deal.

Episode 12: "Laura's Secret Diary" | 47 mins.
Maddy receives a mysterious message from Harold. Cooper and Truman question Jacoby, and Lucy reveals she's pregnant.

Episode 13: "The Orchid's Curse" | 47 mins.
Cooper and Truman rescue Audrey from One Eyed Jacks. Leland's behavior becomes increasingly erratic, and Donna and Maddy plot to steal Laura's diary.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

agePolicies.name: All Ages
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
